Question: What is Traditional Auto Debit Arrangement?
Answer: Traditional Auto Debit Arrangement is a service that lets customers subscribe to an automated debit schedule by filling out printed ADA Forms based on selected bank.

Question: What are the requirements for an Traditional Auto Debit Arrangement (ADA)?
Answer: You must have a savings account with one of the following banks: BPI, Metrobank, RCBC, BDO, Unionbank, Security Bank and PNB

Question: How to enroll for Auto-Debit Arrangement (ADA)?
Answer: If you want to enroll for ADA as your payment method during application, please bring your bank account information, such as Full Name registered on your bank and your bank account number. Our Sales Agent will be glad to process your ADA enrollment.

Question: How would I know if my Traditional Auto-Debit Arrangement (ADA) application was approved or rejected?
Answer: An SMS will be sent within 15 banking days of filling out the ADA form informing you of the approval or rejection. Should the application be rejected, you are still free to pay your installment through any of our accredited payment channels like Maya, Shopee, Palawan Express, USSC and Touchpay.

Question: When will you debit the payment from my account if I am enrolled to Traditional ADA/eADA?
Answer: Debiting of payment is based on the recommended due date stated on your account, which is three (3) calendar days prior to your due date. This is done so that in case debiting from your bank account is unsuccessful, you would still have three (3) days to pay the installment through other channels so as to avoid late payment.

Question: I am enrolled in Auto Debit Arrangement (Traditional or eADA). How will I know if my payment was successfully debited on my bank account?
Answer: You will receive an SMS & email within the day from your payment to confirm status. You can view your transaction throughMy Payments web portal맖rMy Home Credit App. But in case that your ADA is unsuccessful, you will receive an SMS notification stating that we were unable to deduct on your account. Please coordinate this with your bank. For the meantime, you may pay your monthly installment through our accredited payment channels.

Question: What is the Pay Bill feature in the My Home Credit app?
Answer: Pay Bill is a new feature availabe in My Home Credit app that lets you pay for your bills with over 3000 billing partners.

Question: Who can use the Pay Bill feature in the My Home Credit app?
Answer: All Home Credit customers with a registered account in the My Home Credit app can use the Pay Bill feature provided they have a Home Credit Card and a Home Credit Qwarta.

Question: How do I pay my bills online using the My Home Credit app?
Answer:
Make sure to update your My Home Credit app to the latest version and simply follow these easy steps:
1.	Tap Pay Bills in the dashboard of your My Home Credit app.
2.	Select the category of the billing partner you want to pay.
3.	Enter your billing details (i.e. account name, account number and the amount to pay).
4.	Choose the payment method you want to use and confirm your payment details.
5.	A receipt will pop-up once your payment is successful.
